name: GetYourGuide
tagline: A simple ruby client for Getyourguide partner XML API
body:
# Wiki summary

- Make API Calls and parse:
  - [product_list](https://github.com/Libertrip/getyourguide/wiki/API-product-list)
  - [destination_list](https://github.com/Libertrip/getyourguide/wiki/API-destination-list)
  - [image_format_list](https://github.com/Libertrip/getyourguide/wiki/API-image-format-list)
  - [category_list](https://github.com/Libertrip/getyourguide/wiki/API-category-list)
  - [top_categories](https://github.com/Libertrip/getyourguide/wiki/API-top-categories)

- [Gem's models](https://github.com/Libertrip/getyourguide/wiki/Gem-models)
- [Optional parameters](https://github.com/Libertrip/getyourguide/wiki/API-optional-parameters)

# Installation

Add this line to your application's Gemfile:

```ruby
gem 'getyourguide'
```

And then execute:

    $ bundle

Or install it yourself as:

    $ gem install getyourguide

# Usage

## I. The easy way

```ruby
require 'getyourguide'

# required
partner_id        = 'XXXXXXXXXX'
options           = {
  :q => 'product_list',
  :where => 'Rome'
}

# optional (default is set to EN)
language          = 'fr'

api             = GetYourGuide::ApiClient.new(partner_id, language)
parsed_activities = api.call_and_parse(options)
```

# Contributing

1. Fork it ( [https://github.com/Libertrip/getyourguide/fork](https://github.com/Libertrip/getyourguide/fork) )
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request
